15.text:
The Jupiter Mining Corporation Starbug Class
Ship-to-Surface Transport fills an important

20.text:
role within the corporation’s fleet. Assigned
to the JMC’s massive Solar Class Mining

25.text:
Ships, the Starbug is used to carry cargo
and personnel from the larger vessel to a

30.text:
planet’s surface or orbital installation.
The Starbug was famously unreliable, cheaply

35.text:
made and prone to malfunction.
The numerous Class 2 Starbugs assigned to

39.text:
the JMC Mining Vessel Red Dwarf suffered from
the same budget cutbacks as their mothership,

45.text:
and were beginning to show their age even
before the Cadmium 2 radiation leak which

49.text:
exterminated the ship’s crew. Shortly before
the incident, the Class 2 Starbug was withdrawn

54.text:
from service due to major flight design issues,
and Red Dwarf’s complement was scheduled

58.text:
for decommissioning. Despite their obvious
flaws, the Starbugs aboard Red Dwarf endured

63.text:
the following three million years of neglect
uncharacteristically well, requiring only

67.text:
minor repairs before they could be used again.
Slightly larger than the standard Blue Midget

73.text:
Shuttlecraft, the Starbug is able to undertake
journeys of a much greater distance, and,

77.text:
though cramped and uncomfortable, provide
basic living conditions for a small crew.

81.text:
Though the Starbug’s design function is
that of a freighter and transport shuttle,

85.text:
the ship often found use as a scout vessel
and survey craft, providing it’s gargantuan,

90.text:
slow-paced mothership with a means of investigating
potential dangers and points of interest without

95.text:
deviating from its own course.
Though the factory Starbug was not equipped

99.text:
with energy weapons, the ship did carry Limpet
Mine launchers and a basic cloaking device,

104.text:
proving the ship with some means of self-defence
and stealth functionality. The Starbug was

108.text:
not only capable of atmospheric flight, but
also of operating underwater. In addition

112.text:
to this the vessel was equipped with deployable
caterpillar tracks for slow movement across

116.text:
land and carried small boats and buggies for
use by landing parties. The Starbug’s design

122.text:
team was apparently so convinced that the
ship would never find itself engaged in combat

127.text:
they installed only a single lightbulb in
the cockpit alert light, so that bringing

131.text:
the ship to Red Alert Condition required the
crew to manually change the bulb.

135.text:
Of the various Starbug craft left aboard Red
Dwarf many were lost to accidents and malfunctions,

141.text:
but the lead vessel of Red Dwarf’s complement,
Starbug One, not only survived far longer

146.text:
than its sister ships, but also received a
great deal of upgrades and refits across its

150.text:
life-cycle. After the remaining crew of Red
Dwarf lost control of their mothership following

155.text:
the despair squid incident, Starbug One became
the crew’s primary means of transport as

160.text:
they pursued their lost vessel. Lacking any
real weaponry, the crew made use of the ship’s

164.text:
garbage disposal unit to launch molten balls
of waste at attackers.

169.text:
During the hunt for Red Dwarf, Starbug One
encountered a Hostile Simulant Death Ship,

174.text:
who’s crew, in order to provide themselves
with a greater challenge, equipped the Starbug

178.text:
with laser cannons, flares and improved engines.
Much to the surprise of the Simulants, the

183.text:
Starbug crew then used these weapons to destroy
them immediately. Later encounters led to

188.text:
the ship receiving a 300% engine speed upgrade
from an intelligent virus and a 212% increase

194.text:
in the ship’s internal space after a complex
dimensional anomaly. The anomaly created a

198.text:
pocket dimension which increased the size
of the vessel’s interior while keeping its

203.text:
exterior the same size, this extra space was
used to outfit Starbug One with extra sleeping

208.text:
quarters, a larger cargo bay, a medical centre
and an upgraded artificial reality suite.

213.text:
Sadly, Starbug One was eventually lost after
an uncontrolled crash landing aboard Red Dwarf,

218.text:
but the former crew of the Starbug, recognising
that the small and outdated spacecraft had

223.text:
time and again shown resilience and reliability
far in excess of its design and reputation,

228.text:
had another of the Mining Ship’s many remaining
Starbug’s renamed “Starbug One” in honour

233.text:
of the ship that had helped them pursue and
reclaim their stolen home.
